author: R Krishnamoorthy
text:
The district administration has taken possession of five consignments of Electronic Voting Machines from Beed district in Maharashtra under the directions of Election Commission of India.

The EVMs consisting of 2,850 ballot units and as many control units sent in five lorries for safekeeping were unloaded and stored in the Corporation Kamarajar Higher Secondary School under police protection on Saturday.

District Collector inspected the process along with representatives of recognised political parties. The EVMs would be utilised for conduct of elections to the Assembly in the eight segments in the district: Erode East, Erode West, Perundurai, Modakurichi, Bhavani, Gobichettipalayam, Anthiyur and Bhavani Sagar. A team of engineers from Bharat Electronics Limited is expected to examine the EVMs in a few days and make them ready for use.

The entire unloading was videographed in the presence of Revenue Divisional Officer R. Narmadadevi, Tahsildar Mohana, Election Tahsildar M. Sethuraj, and other senior officials.
title: EVMs arrive in Erode
